SKOS_CONCEPT.definition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the subject's average value over a defined set of records.
SKOS_CONCEPT.pref_label: Average of Value Derivation Technique

SKOS_CONCEPT.definition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the best possible outcome.
SKOS_CONCEPT.pref_label: Best Case Imputation Technique

SKOS_CONCEPT.definition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the subject's non-missing baseline observation.
SKOS_CONCEPT.pref_label: Baseline Observation Carried Forward Imputation Technique

SKOS_CONCEPT.definition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the best outcome recorded within a subject.
SKOS_CONCEPT.pref_label: Best Observed Case Imputation Technique

SKOS_CONCEPT.definition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the subject's previous best-case non-missing value.
SKOS_CONCEPT.pref_label: Best Observation Carried Forward Imputation Technique

SKOS_CONCEPT.definition: A technique that uses assignment logic to duplicate an analysis value to be used in additional evaluations.
SKOS_CONCEPT.pref_label: Copy Duplication Imputation Technique

SKOS_CONCEPT.definition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to an estimation of a value based on extending a known sequence of values.
SKOS_CONCEPT.pref_label: Extrapolation Imputation Technique

SKOS_CONCEPT.alt_label: One Half of Lower Limit of Quantification
SKOS_CONCEPT.definition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to one half of the lower limit of quantification of a test.
SKOS_CONCEPT.pref_label: One Half of Lower Limit of Quantification Derivation Technique

SKOS_CONCEPT.definition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to a function of known values to estimate a value within the range.
SKOS_CONCEPT.pref_label: Interpolation Imputation Technique

SKOS_CONCEPT.definition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the lower limit of detection of a test.
SKOS_CONCEPT.pref_label: Detection Limit

SKOS_CONCEPT.definition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the lower limit of quantification of a test.
SKOS_CONCEPT.pref_label: Lower Limit of Quantification Derivation Technique

SKOS_CONCEPT.definition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the subject's previous non-missing value.
SKOS_CONCEPT.pref_label: Last Observation Carried Forward Imputation Technique

SKOS_CONCEPT.definition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the subject's last recorded non-missing observation.
SKOS_CONCEPT.pref_label: Last Observed Value Imputation Technique

SKOS_CONCEPT.definition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the subject's last observed value prior to the start of study treatment.
SKOS_CONCEPT.pref_label: Last Value Prior to Dosing Imputation Technique

SKOS_CONCEPT.definition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the subject's maximum value over a defined set of records.
SKOS_CONCEPT.pref_label: Maximum Value Derivation Technique

SKOS_CONCEPT.definition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the subject's minimum value over a defined set of records.
SKOS_CONCEPT.pref_label: Minimum Value Derivation Technique

SKOS_CONCEPT.definition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the estimate that maximizes the probability of observing what has in fact been observed.
SKOS_CONCEPT.pref_label: Maximum Likelihood Estimation

SKOS_CONCEPT.definition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the mean value from a comparator or reference group.
SKOS_CONCEPT.pref_label: Mean of Other Group Imputation Technique

SKOS_CONCEPT.alt_label: Mean Observed Value in a Group
SKOS_CONCEPT.definition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the mean value observed in a group of subjects.
SKOS_CONCEPT.pref_label: Mean Observed Value in a Group Imputation Technique

SKOS_CONCEPT.definition: A technique that creates a record with a missing analysis value when there is no observed record for a given analysis visit or analysis timepoint.
SKOS_CONCEPT.pref_label: Phantom Record Imputation Technique

SKOS_CONCEPT.definition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the subject's next-to-last non-missing value.
SKOS_CONCEPT.pref_label: Penultimate Observation Carried Forward Imputation Technique

SKOS_CONCEPT.definition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the subject's non-missing screening observation.
SKOS_CONCEPT.pref_label: Screening Observation Carried Forward Imputation Technique

SKOS_CONCEPT.definition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the upper limit of detection of a test.
SKOS_CONCEPT.pref_label: Upper Limit of Detection Imputation Technique

SKOS_CONCEPT.definition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the upper limit of quantification of a test.
SKOS_CONCEPT.pref_label: Upper Limit of Quantification Derivation Technique

SKOS_CONCEPT.definition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the worst possible outcome.
SKOS_CONCEPT.pref_label: Worst Case Imputation Technique

SKOS_CONCEPT.definition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the worst recorded outcome within a subject.
SKOS_CONCEPT.pref_label: Worst Observed Case Imputation Technique

SKOS_CONCEPT.definition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the subject's worst-case non-missing observation.
SKOS_CONCEPT.pref_label: Worst Observation Carried Forward Imputation Technique

SKOS_CONCEPT.alt_label: Worst Observed Value in a Group
SKOS_CONCEPT.definition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the worst value observed in a group of subjects.
SKOS_CONCEPT.pref_label: Worst Observed Value in a Group Imputation Technique
